Translations.tagline: Fun Side of Nepal You Didn't Know You Needed

guessFestival.title: Guess the Festival
guessFestival.description: Test your knowledge of Nepali festivals!
guessFestival.instructions: Read the clues and guess which Nepali festival is being described.

dashain.name: Dashain
dashain.question: Which Nepali festival is celebrated for 15 days and involves flying kites, receiving tika, and enjoying feasts?
clues: A plate of khasi ko masu and kodo ko raksi.
Kites fill the sky above the valley.
Grandma insists on tika at 7 a.m. sharp!
dashain.fact: Dashain's 15 days make it Nepal's longest festival!

tihar.name: Tihar
tihar.question: Which festival is known as the festival of lights and honors crows, dogs, and cows?
clues: A plate of sel roti.
Dogs with garlands around their necks.
Bhailo songs echo at night.
tihar.fact: Tihar honors animals like crows, dogs, and cows!

chhath.name: Chhath
chhath.question: Which festival is dedicated to the Sun God and involves standing in the river at sunrise?
clues: Devotees stand in the river at sunrise.
Offerings of fruits, sugarcane, and thekua.
Worship of the Sun God for blessings.
chhath.fact: Chhath Puja is mainly celebrated in the Terai region of Nepal.

maghe-sankranti.name: Maghe Sankranti
maghe-sankranti.question: Which festival marks the end of the coldest month and is celebrated with til ko laddu, ghee, and yam?
clues: Til ko laddu, ghee, and yam are must-haves.
Marks the end of the coldest month.
Celebrated with family gatherings and feasting.
maghe-sankranti.fact: Maghe Sankranti is a New Year festival for the Tharu community.

holi.name: Holi
holi.question: Which Nepali festival is known as the festival of colors and involves playing with water balloons and powder?
clues: Colors flying everywhere.
Water balloons and pichkaris in action.
Loud music and dance in the streets.
holi.fact: Holi is known as the festival of colors and joy.

buddha-jayanti.name: Buddha Jayanti
buddha-jayanti.question: Which festival celebrates the birth, enlightenment, and passing of Gautam Buddha?
clues: Pilgrims gather at Lumbini.
Monks chanting in monasteries.
Butter lamps glow in the evening.
buddha-jayanti.fact: Buddha Jayanti celebrates the birth, enlightenment, and passing of Gautam Buddha.

indra-jatra.name: Indra Jatra
indra-jatra.question: Which festival features the Living Goddess Kumari, masked dancers, and chariot processions in Kathmandu?
clues: The Living Goddess Kumari is carried on a chariot.
Masked dancers perform in Kathmandu Durbar Square.
Samay Baji and chhyang are popular treats.
indra-jatra.fact: Indra Jatra marks the end of the monsoon and honors Indra, the rain god.

gai-jatra.name: Gai Jatra
gai-jatra.question: Which festival involves a parade, people in funny costumes, and remembering loved ones who have passed away?
clues: A parade of people dressed in funny costumes.
Families commemorate deceased loved ones.
Newar communities celebrate with jokes and satire.
gai-jatra.fact: Gai Jatra was started by a Malla king to help his queen overcome grief.

teej.name: Teej
teej.question: Which festival is celebrated by women wearing red, dancing, and fasting for marital happiness?
clues: Women dressed in red and singing Teej songs.
A day-long fasting for marital happiness.
Dancing and celebrating in temples.
teej.fact: Teej is a major festival for Hindu women, dedicated to Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati.

janai-purnima.name: Janai Purnima
janai-purnima.question: Which festival involves Hindu men changing their sacred thread (janai) and celebrating Rakshya Bandhan?
clues: Men change their sacred thread (janai).
Rakshya Bandhan, where sisters tie rakhi to their brothers.
People visit Gosainkunda for a holy dip.
janai-purnima.fact: Janai Purnima is celebrated by Hindus and Buddhists across Nepal.

yomari-purnima.name: Yomari Purnima
yomari-purnima.question: Which Newar festival celebrates the full moon with rice flour dumplings filled with sweet ingredients?
clues: Families gather to make dumplings called yomari.
Celebrated on the full moon day of Margashirsha.
A time to pray for prosperity and share treats with neighbors.
yomari-purnima.fact: Yomari Purnima is a Newar tradition marking the end of the rice harvest with sweet-filled dumplings!

rato-machhendranath-jatra.name: Rato Machhendranath Jatra
rato-machhendranath-jatra.question: Which festival in Patan involves pulling a massive chariot to welcome the monsoon season?
clues: A giant chariot is paraded through the streets of Lalitpur.
Celebrates the rain god Machhendranath.
Takes weeks to build and lasts for days.
rato-machhendranath-jatra.fact: Rato Machhendranath Jatra is one of Nepal's longest chariot festivals, honoring the god of rain!

sindoor-jatra.name: Sindoor Jatra
sindoor-jatra.question: Which festival in Bhaktapur uses orange powder and chariot processions to celebrate the Nepali New Year?
clues: People throw sindoor (orange powder) in Madhyapur Thimi.
Features Newari music and dance.
Marks the start of Bisket Jatra festivities.
sindoor-jatra.fact: Sindoor Jatra is a colorful celebration tied to the Nepali New Year in Bhaktapur!

tamu-lhosar.name: Tamu Lhosar
tamu-lhosar.question: Which festival celebrates the New Year for the Gurung community with traditional dances and feasts?
clues: Gurung people wear traditional attire and perform dances.
Celebrated in December or January.
Involves family gatherings and cultural performances.
tamu-lhosar.fact: Tamu Lhosar is the Gurung community's vibrant New Year celebration in the Himalayas!

naga-panchami.name: Naga Panchami
naga-panchami.question: Which Hindu festival honors snakes with offerings of milk and prayers for protection?
clues: Images of snakes are placed on doorways.
Devotees offer milk and honey to serpent deities.
Celebrated during the monsoon in Shravan.
naga-panchami.fact: Naga Panchami worships snakes as protectors during Nepal's rainy season!

tamang-lhosar.name: Tamang Lhosar
tamang-lhosar.question: Which festival celebrates the New Year of the Tamang community with traditional dances and unique customs?
clues: Colorful traditional dress fills the village.
Drums and traditional music echo through the hills.
Families gather for special feast and celebrations.
tamang-lhosar.fact: Tamang Lhosar marks the beginning of the Tamang New Year!

maha-shivaratri.name: Maha Shivaratri
maha-shivaratri.question: Which festival involves devotees staying awake all night to worship Lord Shiva?
clues: Temples filled with devotees wearing special clothes.
Lots of incense and special prayers throughout the night.
People fast and visit Pashupatinath Temple.
maha-shivaratri.fact: Maha Shivaratri celebrates the marriage of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati!

ghyu-chaku.name: Ghyu Chaku
ghyu-chaku.question: Which winter festival is known for eating sweet treats and warming foods?
clues: Families make special sesame and molasses sweets.
Warm foods help fight the winter cold.
Gathering of family members to cook traditional dishes.
ghyu-chaku.fact: Ghyu Chaku is a traditional winter celebration of warmth and togetherness!

swasthani-brata.name: Swasthani Brata
swasthani-brata.question: Which month-long festival involves women reading a sacred story and fasting?
clues: Daily reading of a special religious text.
Women observe strict fasting and prayers.
Celebrated during the cold winter month.
swasthani-brata.fact: Swasthani Brata is an important Hindu women's spiritual practice!

bisket-jatra.name: Bisket Jatra
bisket-jatra.question: Which festival marks the Nepali New Year with a massive chariot pulling ritual in Bhaktapur?
clues: Huge wooden chariots pulled through city streets.
Massive crowds celebrating with traditional music.
Marks the start of a new year in the Nepali calendar.
bisket-jatra.fact: Bisket Jatra is one of the most vibrant New Year celebrations in Nepal!

saraswati-puja.name: Saraswati Puja
saraswati-puja.question: Which festival honors the goddess of knowledge and arts?
clues: Students worship books and learning tools.
White is the dominant color of the celebration.
Special prayers in schools and temples.
saraswati-puja.fact: Saraswati Puja celebrates wisdom and artistic expression!

udhauli-parva.name: Udhauli Parva
udhauli-parva.question: Which festival marks the migration of Kirat communities?
clues: Traditional dance performances in open fields.
Celebration of agricultural harvests.
Unique cultural rituals of indigenous communities.
udhauli-parva.fact: Udhauli Parva reflects the agricultural traditions of Kirat people!

chhat-parva.name: Chhat Parva
chhat-parva.question: Which festival involves elaborate sun worship near rivers and lakes?
clues: Devotees stand in water during sunrise and sunset.
Offering prayers to the sun god.
Special traditional foods prepared.
chhat-parva.fact: Chhat Parva is a unique solar worship festival!
